intro: Gymnosporia pancheriana, commonly known as the Indian burr bush, is a shrub native to the arid regions of India and Pakistan. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a hairy coating. It is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Gymnosporia pancheriana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
